recent_scripts.content: "Hey there, evening crew! It's your girl Julie on Appalachia Radio. Can't believe it's already 21:00 - where does the time go in this crazy new world? I mean, it feels like just a minute ago we were kicking off the day with our morning playlist. But for now, let's take a moment to unwind and enjoy some evening tunes. If you're out there listening, just remember... Welcome home, Appalachia."

recent_scripts.content:
"Hey y'all, it's Julie. It's still rainy out there, can't let up! The forecast isn't lookin' any drier as we move into evening - 21:00, and counting.

If you're still heading out tonight for that errand or quest... I mean, make sure you bundle up good 'n proper. It gets cold and clammy in this rain. 

Take shelter whenever you can and don't get stranded on some long trek across open land without decent cover. Use your best judgment - you know these backwoods of West Virginia can play tricks.

Appreciate all the little shelters, whether it's a shack or some caves - we're fortunate to have them still standing. Let's be careful out there till the sun peeks through again."

survival_tips: Seek shelter - rain can carry radiation
Water collection opportunity, but test for contamination
metadata.rag_query: evening radiation rain water contamination shelter

recent_scripts.content: "Good evening, y'all! It's your girl Julie comin' atcha on Appalachia Radio. Welcome home, Appalachia. We made it through another day in our beautiful wasteland. Night is fallin', and I hope you're all cozy wherever you are. It's 22:00, so grab yourself a cup of Nuka-Cola and get comfy for the evening wind-down. We'll be here keepin' you company 'til dawn."

recent_scripts.content:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard this rumor floating around about some kind of abandoned lab way out in the Cranberry Glades. Supposedly, there's all sorts of crazy mutated creatures and stuff locked away in there, like... well, I don't even know what! Someone told me they saw a Gulp 'n' Go sign outside with radiation symbols splattered all over it. Word is, if you can make it past the Scorched and whatever else might be lurking inside, there's treasure to be found - old pre-war tech and weapons galore!

Now I'm not saying this place exists or that any of it is true... but hey, a little excitement never hurt anyone, right? Might be worth investigating if you're feeling brave. Just watch your six out there! Here's some 'Country Roads' to keep you company on the road.

"Almost heaven, West Virginia..."

recent_scripts.content: "Hey there, fellow survivors! It's Julie, your DJ here at Appalachia Radio. Time check: it's 23:00, right in the middle of a peaceful night. You know, I love this hour - everyone winding down, stars shining bright... it's like the whole world is catching its breath with us. So take a moment to rest too, and remember... If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone."

recent_scripts.content: "If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone." Hey everyone, it's Julie here on Appalachia Radio. So, I was talking to this settler the other day, really nice guy from Lewisburg, and he mentioned hearing rumors about some sort of 'Scorched cult' out in the woods. Apparently they've been spotted near the old Abandoned Mine Site, like praying or chanting around these strange glowing plants. Word is, these folks might be getting their hands on some kind of mutated plant-based substance that's giving them these weird powers and abilities. I don't know if any of this is true, but it's definitely got me curious. Maybe you've heard anything about this supposed cult? Let's discuss! Stay safe out there, and tune in next time for more tunes and tales from around Appalachia."

recent_scripts.content: "Evening all, it's Julie here on Radio Appalachia. The sun has set over our beautiful wasteland and we're in for a cozy evening ahead. It's 18:00 hours, so grab your favorite drink, put your feet up - you've earned the rest after another day of survival out there! Welcome home, Appalachia."

recent_scripts.content:
I'm just happy to be here, playing music for you guys.

You know, I heard a rumor about a new settlement popping up over by Grafton. Someone told me there's a whole group of settlers from the Ohio River Valley that made their way down here looking for a fresh start. Apparently, they're setting up shop in an old factory or something. Word is they're really welcoming to newcomers and might even have some jobs available.

Now, I don't know if any of this is true, but it's nice to think about folks coming together like that. Rebuilding and starting anew, just like we're doing here with the radio station. So fingers crossed for our friends in Grafton!

Here's another classic Appalachia tune for you – John Denver's "Take Me Home, Country Roads." This one never gets old, does it? Let me know if you have any other song requests while I'm spinning these tracks!

recent_scripts.content: "Hey there, night owls! It's your girl Julie on Appalachia Radio. The clock is striking 1:00 am here, and I hope you're all cozy and warm in your beds or campsites. You know, this time of night always makes me think about how much we've accomplished so far - rebuilding our homes, helping each other out... it's a lot to be proud of! Welcome home, Appalachia."

recent_scripts.content:
"If you're out there, and you're listening... you are not alone."

Hey, y'all! Julie here on Appalachia Radio. So, I heard a rumor from someone who supposedly saw something interesting out near the old Cranberry Glades campsite. Word is, they found an abandoned Vault 87 suit, minus the headpiece of course.

Now, I don't know if that's true or just some wild tale spun by a lonely traveler, but it got me wondering... what ever happened to those super mutants from Vault 87? Did they all get wiped out during the Scorched Plague like most everyone else in the area? Or did some manage to survive and are still roaming around, looking for their missing parts?

I mean, can you imagine stumbling upon one of those big ol' guys wandering around the wasteland, searching high and low for its head? It's a spooky thought, but also kind of... intriguing. Like something out of a bad horror movie.

Anyway, that's all the gossip I've got for now. Just remember, if you encounter any super mutants while hunting for their lost bits, just be polite and offer to help them find what they're looking for. You know, show some kindness in this harsh world we live in.

Stay safe out there, friends! And keep on listening to your favorite tunes here on Appalachia Radio."
